verbose_text: The application of theophylline or the A 1 -specific antagonist cyclopentyl dipropylxanthine, but not the A 2A -receptor antagonist SCH58261, caused an increase in locomotor burst frequency, demonstrating that endogenously derived adenosine activates A 1 receptors during locomotor network activity.
evidence: theophylline or the A 1 -specific antagonist cyclopentyl dipropylxanthine, but not the A 2A -receptor antagonist SCH58261, caused an increase in locomotor burst frequency, demonstrating that endogenously derived adenosine activates A 1  receptors
